headline.main: THE EASTERN QUESTION.; Another Letter from M. Xavier Raymond.

docs.lead_paragraph: I send you a duplicate of the proposed Note handed in by M. DE BRUCK to the Porte, on Thursday, Oct. 20.
docs.snippet: I send you a duplicate of the proposed Note handed in by M. DE BRUCK to the Porte, on Thursday, Oct. 20.

byline.original: Correspondence of the Journal Des Debats:

docs.lead_paragraph: The records of the terrible and unprecedented marine mortality do not at all fall off. The papers seem agreed to speak of it as cholera, and probably it is that, but it is very little we know of the matter, considering the ravages that have been made.
docs.snippet: The records of the terrible and unprecedented marine mortality do not at all fall off. The papers seem agreed to speak of it as cholera, and probably it is that, but it is very little we know of the matter, considering the ravages that have been...

headline.main: EUROPEAN AFFAIRS.; Arrival of the Canada's Mails. DETAILS CONCERNING THE WAR IN THE EAST. POSITION OF THE RUSSIANS AND TURKS. Interesting and Important Extracts from the English Press. THE LATEST BATTLE. Extraordinary Success of the Turks-Turks 12,000 vs. 30,000 Russians.

docs.lead_paragraph: If we may venture upon translating into anything like a circumstantial exposition of events the reports flashed across the Continent by the wires of a telegraph, we must prepare our readers for intelligence yet more unexpected than any hitherto received from the seat of war on the Danube.
docs.snippet: If we may venture upon translating into anything like a circumstantial exposition of events the reports flashed across the Continent by the wires of a telegraph, we must prepare our readers for intelligence yet more unexpected than any hitherto...

headline.main: WASHINGTON.; Health of the President-Political and Miscellaneous Intelligence.

docs.lead_paragraph: The President attended Thanksgiving service this morning, although he looks far from well. Notwithstanding his indisposition during the last few days, he has been much engaged in the preparation of his Message, which is now rapidly approaching completion.
docs.snippet: The President attended Thanksgiving service this morning, although he looks far from well. Notwithstanding his indisposition during the last few days, he has been much engaged in the preparation of his Message, which is now rapidly approaching...

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

headline.main: AMHERST COLLEGE.; The Opening of the New Library Building of Amherst College.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Alumnus of Amherst College, who was graduated here twenty, or even ten years ago, am'd much that is unchanged and unchangeable, finds, on revisiting his Alma, many things not a little altered and improved.
docs.snippet: The Alumnus of Amherst College, who was graduated here twenty, or even ten years ago, am'd much that is unchanged and unchangeable, finds, on revisiting his Alma, many things not a little altered and improved.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

docs.lead_paragraph: The President has nearly recovered his health, and will he able to be out to-day. The Message is nearly completed, and will be sent in advance to distant newspapers, all rumors to the contrary notwithstanding.
docs.snippet: The President has nearly recovered his health, and will he able to be out to-day. The Message is nearly completed, and will be sent in advance to distant newspapers, all rumors to the contrary notwithstanding.

headline.main: THANKSGIVING DISCOURSES.; THE DUTIES OF A NATION.
WASHINGTON.; The Presidents Health and Message, and his Views on the Pacific Railroad Project--Our army, &c., &c.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

headline.main: THANKSQIVINO DISCOURSES.; [See Third Page.] DOMESTIC HAPPINESS. Discourse by Rev. Wm. Adams, Pastor of the Madison-square Presbyterian Church.

docs.lead_paragraph: A very excellent practical Thanksgiving Discourse was delivered by Rev. Dr. ADAMS, Pastor of the Madison-square Presbyterian Church, in the temporary place of worship occupied by that Society in Hope Chapel. The subject was the "Fewness, Simplicity and Commonness of the Objects essential to the Highest Measure of Pleasure, Contentment and Comfort."
docs.snippet: A very excellent practical Thanksgiving Discourse was delivered by Rev. Dr. ADAMS, Pastor of the Madison-square Presbyterian Church, in the temporary place of worship occupied by that Society in Hope Chapel. The subject was the "Fewness, Simplicity...

headline.main: FROM THE WEST.; The Exploration of Governor Stevens.

docs.lead_paragraph: Lieut. SAXTON, with a detachment of dragoons, accompanied by Mr. CUTHBERTSON, an old Indian trader, and Mr. TERIS, one of our merchants, arrived in this city from the Upper Missouri, They bring later accounts from Gov. STEVENS. Lieut. SAXTON was dispatched from the Pacific coast with provisions and supplies for Governor STEVENS. He has made deposits at several points west of the Rocky Mountains.
